panels.description: The number of CNP packets sent by the Notification Point when it noticed congestion experienced in the RoCEv2 IP header (ECN bits).
panels.title: CNP Packets Sent Rate by Device

panels.description: The number of RoCEv2 packets received by the notification point which were marked for experiencing the congestion (ECN bits where '11' on the ingress RoCE traffic) .
panels.title: ECN Marked RoCEv2 Packets Rate by Device

panels.description: The number of CNP packets handled by the Reaction Point HCA to throttle the transmission rate.
panels.title: CNP Packets Handled Rate by Device

panels.description: The number of out of sequence packets received.
panels.title: Out of Sequence Packets Rate by Device

panels.description: The number of CNP packets received and ignored by the Reaction Point HCA. This counter should not raise if RoCE Congestion Control was enabled in the network. If this counter raise, verify that ECN was enabled on the adapter. See HowTo Configure DCQCN (RoCE CC) values for ConnectX-4 (Linux).
panels.title: CNP Packets Ignored Rate by Device

panels.description: The number of times responder detected CQEs completed with flushed errors.
panels.title: Resp CQE Flush Error

panels.description: The number of times requester detected CQEs completed with flushed errors.
panels.title: Req CQE Flush Error

panels.description: Counts the number of adaptive retransmissions for RoCE traffic.
panels.title: RoCE Adaptive Retransmissions Count

panels.description: Counts the number of times RoCE traffic reached timeout due to adaptive retransmission.
panels.title: RoCE Adaptive Retransmission Timeout Count

panels.description: Counts the number of times RoCE slow restart was used.
panels.title: RoCE Slow Restart Count

panels.description: Counts the number of times RoCE slow restart generated CNP packets.
panels.title: RoCE Slow Restart CNP Count
